Posts.Content: desireelo98 wrote: For the past 5 years I’ve been on anxiety medication and medication for my adhd. I am also on birth control. I stopped taking my medication in February and within the next month i ended up becoming a full blown hypochondriac. I'm Hispanic. I’ve had a history with eczema but only on certain parts of my body. I have no history of breast cancer in my family. This month i started having a itchy nipple and I itch hard so i don’t know if this is what caused the rash in the first place but i discovered that I have a rash on my left nipple. my left nipple is dry with a rash around or over it I can’t tell but Ever since the rash happened I've haven't really been getting itchy but when I do I don't itch I just put some Vaseline on it. I've also used two different creams on my nipple before the rash started so that also may be the cause. I Googled rash on nipple. All the results said Breast cancer or Paget's disease of the nipple which is a rare form of breast cancer.so I think to myself. I have breast cancer. I had a full blown panic attack and woke my mom and sister up at midnight. They said "oh it's nothing" "you don't have breast cancer you’re way too young" "the rash will go away" my sister even has had a rash in the same place herself and she said it will go away. I know it’s rare for teenagers and young women to develop Breast cancer and also extremely rare for them to develop pagets but what if I'm that rare 7% that has it? the anxiety of this has been driving me insane and I don’t know if I should rush to see a doctor or wait a few days or weeks to see if it will go away. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 19 years old with rash on left nipple desireelo98 desireelo98

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2018 03:56AM desireelo98 wrote: I’m so relieved! I went to the doctors today. I Was lump free and was given three different anti fungal creams for ringwormso hopefully it’ll go away within 2-3 weeks :)
Posts.Title: 19 years old with rash on left nipple desireelo98 desireelo98

Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2018 05:03AM desireelo98 wrote: hi! So the rash did not spread but over the weeks it has turned into something that looks like ring worm! I will be going to doctors Tomorow I’m super nervous :( I really hope that its just ring worm and not anything candrous
Posts.Title: 19 years old with rash on left nipple desireelo98 desireelo98

Posts.Content: May 21, 2018 12:55AM - edited May 21, 2018 01:01AM by desireelo98 well...I started treating the rash on April 10th and I THOUGHT it finally went away May 8th but then on May 12th I itched my nipple and the rash went right back to being red. I might have to see a dermatologist if this doesn’t go away on it’s own completely. My doctor said no to getting a mammogram. And also ever since I started using those three creams now my left nipple is prone to chafing. I went back to using the creams on the 15th
